Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, or forest, showing at least three different kinds of living things like trees, bushes, or squirrels.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake, showing at least three different kinds of living things like fish, clams, or aquatic plants.
The student can include a variety of plants and animals in their drawings to show biodiversity.
The student can compare the different types of living things in each habitat by showing both similarities and differences.
The student can use patterns to show how living things are organized in the habitat, such as grouping similar plants or animals together.
